docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 3.--The subcommission's revised text of amendments to the League of Nations covenant drafted by the jurists with a view to bringing it into harmony with the peace pacts and the one for the renunciation of war were given out today after...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 3.--The subcommission's revised text of amendments to the League of Nations covenant drafted by the jurists with a view to bringing it into harmony with the peace pacts and the one for the renunciation of war were given out today after the Assembly's first commission had decided to send both ...
docs.abstract: Amendments to league of Nations covenant

headline.main: LEAGUE PUBLISHES AMENDMENT TEXTS; Governments Asked to Study Them and Give Their Views Before Next June. COUNCIL'S POWER REDUCED Change Removes Proposed Obligatory Character of Recommendations by Unanimous Decision. Decides to Delay Action. Cases to Be Decided Individually.

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREIT. Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Oct. 4.--Revolution has broken out in the States of Rio Grande do Sui, Parana, Minas Geraes and Rio de Janeiro but on account of the strict censorship the details and extent of the uprising are unknown.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Oct. 4.--Revolution has broken out in the States of Rio Grande do Sui, Parana, Minas Geraes and Rio de Janeiro but on account of the strict censorship the details and extent of the uprising are unknown.
docs.abstract: Revolt in States of Rio Grande do Sul, Parana, Minas Geraes and Rio de Janeiro; details unknown because of censorship

docs.snippet: Invitations for tenders of bonds for the sinking funds of several issues have been announced. In the number are four foreign issues, two of Bolivia and two of Uruguay.

headline.main: BONDS ARE SOUGHT FOR SINKING FUNDS; Announcements Include Parts of Two Issues Each by Bolivia and Uruguay. $384,885 FOR SINCLAIR OIL Tenders of First Lien Collateral Securities Invited--Other Retirements Planned.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5.--Business conditions in politically disturbed Latin America were described in a Department of Commerce statement today as generally unsatisfactory and subnormal during September.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5.--Business conditions in politically disturbed Latin America were described in a Department of Commerce statement today as generally unsatisfactory and subnormal during September.
docs.abstract: Rept on business for Sept by Dept of Commerce

headline.main: TRADE OUTLOOK POOR IN LATIN AMERICA; Commerce Department Says Conditions Continued Unsatisfactory In September.MEXICAN CROPS REDUCED Cuban Business Declined FromAugust--Improvement isShown In Argentina. Sugar Given as Bonus. Tourist Traffic Aids.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 5.--Frontier dispatches tonight reported that the Brazilian Federal Government had offered to open peace negotiations with the triumphant insurgents in Rio Grande do Sul, but that the insurgent leaders had refused to accept them.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 5.--Frontier dispatches tonight reported that the Brazilian Federal Government had offered to open peace negotiations with the triumphant insurgents in Rio Grande do Sul, but that the insurgent leaders had refused to accept them.
docs.abstract: Rept that Govt offers peace, refused by rebels; rebels conscript troops; Govt votes sum for defense and supports state of siege; causes of revolt

headline.main: BRAZIL ASKS PEACE, BUT REBELS REFUSE; Triumphant Insurgents Take 'Responsibility for Bloodshed,' Montevideo Says. CAPITAL VOTES $12,000,000 Acts to Support State of Siege --Refugees Throng Towns on Uruguayan Border. Rebels Conscript Troops. BRAZIL ASKS PEACE, BUT REBELS REFUSE Federal Censors Obscure News. Capital Votes State of Siege. Causes for the Revolt. Says Elections Were Engineered.
